Benefit Coverage.question: How do I check how much balance I have left? (RHB/LGI/Companies with benefit limit)
Benefit Coverage.answer: Kindly drop us a message in the portal to check on your utilisation records.

Benefit Coverage.question: Why is my claim up to $40/$60 only?
Benefit Coverage.answer: You would be required to access your Benefits Portal and present the E-card upon registration otherwise the consultation reimbursement would fall under Non-panel GP benefit limit.

Benefit Coverage.question: How do I claim GPA?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Please find the Personal Accident form in the portal under Benefits > Documents, to submit for claims.

Benefit Coverage.question: How long is my referral valid for?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Referral letter to Panel or Non-Panel Specialist from Panel GP will be valid till discharge by Specialist. However, do note that an updated memo is required if the last visit is more than 1 year ago.

Benefit Coverage.question: Do I need a referral letter for visit to Gynae?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Referral letter is waived for visits to gynaecologist for conditions not normally treated by GP.

Benefit Coverage.question: I have been to my specialist but I would like a second opinion.
Benefit Coverage.answer: Please be advised that 2nd opinion is not covered.

Benefit Coverage.question: I don’t have a referral letter, the polyclinic has given me a booking to the GRH for further treatment?
Benefit Coverage.answer: You may contact the hospital/clinic to provide you with the copy of the referral letter.

Benefit Coverage.question: What is the dateline of claims?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Please be advised that claims are to be submitted within 30 days of incurred.

Benefit Coverage.question: What is surgical schedule?
Benefit Coverage.answer: A Surgical schedule is surgical percentage being applied to derive the payable surgeon fees for procedures done in a private hospital.

Benefit Coverage.question: Can I claim for a scope?
Benefit Coverage.answer: There must be signs & symptoms that necessitate the scope being performed. If not, the scope may not be covered. Kindly provide your referral or order form for us to assist you.

Benefit Coverage.question: How much is my coverage if I need to do a cataract surgery?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Kindly be advised that this would depend on if the surgery us done in a private or a government restructured hospital. Kindly provide us with the care cost form/financial cost form for us to advise you further.

Benefit Coverage.question: Why do I need to authorise my Medisave when I’m admitted to the hospital?
For hospital & surgical claims, will the insurance company pay back to my Medisave account?
Benefit Coverage.answer:
If you had used the LOG at the hospital, the insurer would first pay to the hospital, then to you if you had made any 
cheque or cash payment, and finally to your Medisave account less any incurred expenses not covered. If you had 
settled the bill directly at the hospital and utilized your Medisave account, the insurer will first pay to you the cheque 
or cash payment and finally to your Medisave account less any incurred expenses not covered.

Benefit Coverage.question: How does the co-payment work for hospital admission? Can I use my personal insurance?
Benefit Coverage.answer: Yes, you may utilise your Medisave or Personal Insurance for the co-payment amount.

Benefit Coverage.question: How much will be covered and what do I have to pay?
Benefit Coverage.answer: We are unable to advise on the interim, kindly provide the referral letter and/or invoice for us to assist you further.

Letter of Guarantee (LOG).question: How do I request for a Letter of Guarantee?
Letter of Guarantee (LOG).answer:
Please assist to advise us on the following at least 1 week before your procedure:

-	Admission Date:
-	Hospital Name (The surgery must be performing in the hospital operating theatre):
-	Diagnosis: 

Do provide us with the referral letter, pre admission letter, and/or financial cost form where applicable.

Portal Matters.question: How do I submit medical claims?
Portal Matters.answer:
Kindly be advised that employee would have to submit the claims on your behalf through the portal at https://benefits.inspro.com.sg/. 

You may submit your claim under New Claims > Select incurred date using the calendar icon > Claim Category: Insurance

Portal Matters.question: I cannot log in, what is my User ID?
I cannot log in, how do I reset my password?
Portal Matters.answer: Kindly click on the “First Time Login/Forgot your password”

Portal Matters.question: How Can I change my phone number For the OTP?
Portal Matters.answer: Please be advised to email to us at helpdesk@inpro.com.sg with your new contact details for us to update.

Portal Matters.question: I am unable to submit the claim, “consent statement” required? Where is the consent statement?
Portal Matters.answer: Kindly use the calendar icon to select the date for more fields to appear. The consent statement is a toggle button just above the Submit button.

Portal Matters.question: Where can I find my GP Panel List?
Portal Matters.answer:
Please be advised that the GP Listing is updated monthly and it is not advisable to circulate the listing. 

Employee has to access the portal and click on Ecard > Find your nearest clinic, to locate GP under the Panel.

Portal Matters.question: Where can I find my Specialist Panel list?
Portal Matters.answer: Please furnish your referral for us to assist you further. Please be informed that for a Specialist visit, you may contact the Tokyo Marine concierge at 3129 3002 to make an appointment for Panel Specialist.

Portal Matters.question: Why do I have to make payment at Panel clinic?
Portal Matters.answer:
Kindly advise if you have provided the eCard upon registration. Please be advised that Panel clinic may request payment for the following reasons:
(a) Conditions not covered E.g. Prevention – if you are travelling and you ask for flu or diarrhoea medication
although you are not suffering from these medical conditions
(b) Medication not related to the medical condition you are seeking treatment for. E.g. You have flu, but you
ask for cream for your skin
(c) Collection of medicine with no consultation E.g. Calling the doctor to ask for Panadol tablets
(d) Obtaining Referral Letter / Medical Certificate (MC) only. Some doctors will charge even if there is no
medication given as the doctor’s time is taken to issue these documents

Claims Status.question: When will my claims be reimbursed?
Claims Status.answer: Please be informed that all claims processing time will take about 17 working days to a calendar month upon receiving full documentation. You will be notified on the outcome once the insurer has assessed the claim.

Claims Status.question: The status is “paid”, but I haven’t received it on my end.
Claims Status.answer: Please be advised that bank processing may take up to 7 working days.

Claims Status.question: My flexible claims has been submitted for a long time, is there something wrong?
Claims Status.answer: Please be informed that for Flexible benefits claims, the claim processing time will take place after the last day of submission and claims will be approved into the following months' payroll
